title: UX: Add proper 404 page for invalid routes
description:
## Problem
Invalid routes silently redirect to the feed view. Users have no indication that the URL they entered was invalid.

## Current Behavior
- Navigating to /foo/bar/baz shows the feed
- No error message or indication of invalid route
- Invalid profile IDs (/p/invalid) show alert but still render current view

## Expected Behavior
- Clear 404 page with:
  - 'Page not found' message
  - Link back to home
  - Helpful suggestions (search, explore)

## Location
apps/gallery/src/App.tsx - routing logic

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Create NotFoundView component
- [ ] Route unmatched paths to NotFoundView
- [ ] Include 'Go home' link
- [ ] Styled consistently with app theme

title: Accessibility audit & WCAG 2.1 AA compliance
description:
Comprehensive accessibility audit and enhancement to achieve WCAG 2.1 AA compliance. Current state: only 49 ARIA attributes across entire codebase. This is critical for production readiness, legal compliance, and expanding user reach by 15%+.

Scope:
- Add ARIA labels, roles, landmarks to all interactive components
- Implement keyboard navigation for modals, dropdowns, forms
- Add focus management for invoice popover, payment modal, post editor
- Create accessibility E2E tests with Playwright + axe-core
- Document a11y patterns in design system

Target: WCAG 2.1 AA compliance, Lighthouse Accessibility score: 100

Components affected:
- packages/blog-kit/src/ui/*.tsx (PaymentModal, SendSats, ReactionButton)
- apps/gallery/src/*.tsx (FeedView, SearchView, Sidebar)
- packages/embed/src/*.ts (invoicePopover, relayBadge, share)

Deliverables:
- Playwright test: tests/accessibility.spec.ts with axe violations assertions
- Documentation: docs/accessibility.md with patterns + testing guide
- All interactive components with proper ARIA attributes
- Full keyboard navigation support

title: Add Following feed filter
description:
## Problem
Users see all posts from all connected relays. No way to filter to just people they follow. This is THE core social network feature.

## User Story
As a user, I want to toggle between 'All Posts' and 'Following' feeds so I can see content from people I care about.

## Technical Approach
1. Fetch user's contact list (kind 3 event) on login
2. Store follow list in state (already partially done in useMuteList pattern)
3. Add toggle button in FeedView header: 'All' / 'Following'
4. Filter subscription to only include posts from followed pubkeys
5. Update subscription when toggle changes

## Acceptance Criteria
- Toggle button visible in feed header
- 'Following' mode only shows posts from contacts
- Toggle state persists across sessions
- Empty state if no followed users

title: Feature: Add repost/boost functionality to posts
description:
## Problem
PostItem component lacks repost/boost functionality. Users can only:
- React (like)
- Zap (send sats)
- Reply
- View Source

Reposting is a core social media feature for content amplification.

## Expected Behavior
Each post should have a repost/boost button that creates a Kind 6 (repost) event.

## Location
apps/gallery/src/FeedView.tsx - PostItem component (lines 36-197)

## Implementation Notes
- Add repost button next to existing action buttons
- Create Kind 6 event when clicked
- Show repost count similar to reactions
- Optionally: support quote reposts (Kind 1 with reference)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Repost button visible on all posts
- [ ] Clicking creates Kind 6 event
- [ ] Visual feedback on successful repost
- [ ] Show repost count if available

title: UX: Add pagination to SearchView note results
description:
## Problem
Note search in SearchView has a fixed 20 result limit with no pagination or 'load more' functionality.

## Current Behavior
- Search returns maximum 20 notes
- No indication that more results may exist
- No way to load additional results

## Expected Behavior
- 'Load more' button when more results available
- Or infinite scroll with loading indicator
- Clear indication of result count

## Location
apps/gallery/src/SearchView.tsx (lines 57-61)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Implement 'Load more' or infinite scroll for notes
- [ ] Show loading indicator during pagination
- [ ] Handle end-of-results gracefully

title: Product UX Improvements
description:
Based on deep product review, identified key UX gaps that prevent the gallery from being a usable social network:

## Problem
1. **No Following feed** - Users see all posts from all relays, no way to filter to just people they follow. This is THE core social feature.
2. **Terrible DM UX** - DM list shows only hex pubkeys, no profile names/avatars/previews. Users can't identify conversations.
3. **No thread/conversation view** - Posts are flat. Clicking reply opens a modal but doesn't show thread context or nested replies.

## Impact
- Users can't follow the social graph (defeats purpose of social network)
- DMs are unusable for real communication
- Conversations are fragmented and hard to follow

## Success Criteria
- [ ] Following feed filter with toggle
- [ ] DM list shows profile names, avatars, and last message preview
- [ ] Thread view shows full conversation context with nested replies

title: A11y: Add ARIA labels to blog-kit UI components
description:
Add comprehensive ARIA labels and roles to all blog-kit UI components.

Components to update:
- PaymentModal.tsx: modal, dialog, status regions
- SendSats.tsx: form controls, amount presets, error messages
- ZapButton.tsx: button states (idle/pending/paid)
- ReactionButton.tsx: toggle button with aria-pressed
- PostEditor.tsx: textarea, character count, publish button
- ReplyModal.tsx: modal dialog, form controls
- TipActivityFeed.tsx: live region for updates

Acceptance:
- All interactive elements have aria-label or aria-labelledby
- Form controls have aria-describedby for error messages
- Buttons indicate state (aria-pressed, aria-expanded, aria-busy)
- Live regions use aria-live for dynamic content
- Modal components have role=dialog, aria-modal=true

title: A11y: Implement keyboard navigation for all modals
description:
Ensure all modals support full keyboard navigation and focus management.

Modals to update:
- PaymentModal (blog-kit): Tab order, Escape to close, focus trap
- ReplyModal (blog-kit): Focus on textarea when opened, Escape closes
- HelpModal (gallery): Focus management, keyboard shortcuts
- OnboardingTour (gallery): Arrow keys for navigation, Escape to skip

Implementation:
- Focus trap: Tab cycles within modal
- Auto-focus first interactive element on open
- Escape key closes modal (return focus to trigger)
- Arrow keys for multi-step flows (onboarding tour)
- Focus visible indicator styles

Acceptance:
- All modals trap focus (Tab doesn't escape)
- Escape key always closes modal
- Opening modal focuses first input/button
- Closing modal returns focus to trigger element
- Keyboard navigation works without mouse

title: Add pre-commit hooks with husky
description:
## Problem
Developers discover lint/type failures in CI (10+ min feedback loop) instead of locally. No pre-commit hooks are configured.

## Solution
1. Add husky for Git hooks
2. Configure lint-staged for incremental linting
3. Run typecheck on staged files
4. Add pnpm check-dev-setup script to validate prerequisites

## Acceptance Criteria
- Pre-commit hook runs eslint and prettier on staged files
- Commit blocked if lint fails
- Documentation updated with setup instructions

title: Investigate and fix infinite update loop causing QA failures
description:
## Problem

QA tests are failing with 'Maximum update depth exceeded' errors. This is a pre-existing issue (reproduced on main without the performance optimization changes).

## Symptoms

- Live Feed element not visible during QA tests
- Console shows repeated 'Maximum update depth exceeded' errors
- 'Rendered fewer hooks than expected' error
- WebSocket connection failures to telemetry endpoint

## Investigation Needed

1. Identify which component is causing the infinite loop
2. Check for setState calls inside useEffect without proper dependencies
3. Look for dependencies that change on every render
4. Check RelayProvider and other context providers

## Related

- Discovered during work on lightning-831 (performance optimizations)
- Not caused by the batching changes (reproduces on main branch)

title: Developer Experience Improvements
description:
Based on deep codebase review, identified key developer experience improvements:

## Problem
1. **Type safety erosion in embed package** - 20+ @ts-ignore directives, unsafe casts, and no runtime validation. Makes debugging hard and introduces silent failures.
2. **No pre-commit hooks or local validation** - Developers discover lint/type failures in CI (10+ min feedback loop) instead of locally.
3. **Monolithic embed package** - 2,400 LOC single file with closure state hell, magic numbers, and potential memory leaks. Hard to maintain and test.

## Impact
- New contributors get confused by scattered docs and lack of setup validation
- Type safety gaps in embed allow runtime bugs that slip past TypeScript
- CI feedback loop too slow; devs push broken code that fails in CI

## Success Criteria
- [ ] Zero @ts-ignore in packages (replace with proper types)
- [ ] Pre-commit hooks catch lint/type issues locally
- [ ] Embed package split into testable modules with 80%+ coverage

title: UX: Show notification when payment times out
description:
## Problem
Payment modal has a 5-minute timeout that silently closes the modal without notifying the user. This leaves users confused about whether their payment succeeded.

## Current Behavior
- If payment not confirmed within 5 minutes, modal closes
- No notification or error message shown
- User left wondering what happened

## Expected Behavior
- Show clear timeout notification before closing
- Suggest next steps (retry, check wallet, etc.)
- Log telemetry for payment timeouts

## Location
packages/blog-kit/src/ui/send-sats.tsx (lines 287-290)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Show timeout alert before closing modal
- [ ] Include helpful message about possible causes
- [ ] Option to keep modal open or retry

title: UX: Add 'New Message' button to DMView
description:
## Problem
Users cannot initiate new DM conversations from the Messages view. They must already know a peer to message them.

## Expected Behavior
- A prominent 'New Message' or 'Compose' button in the Messages view
- Clicking opens a modal or view to search/select a recipient
- After selecting, opens the conversation

## Current Behavior
- Empty state just says 'No messages yet'
- No way to start a new conversation from scratch

## Location
apps/gallery/src/DMView.tsx

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Add 'New Message' button to DMView header or empty state
- [ ] Button opens recipient search/selection UI
- [ ] After selection, user can compose and send message
- [ ] Accessibility: proper ARIA labels

title: UX: Add edit profile button to ProfileView
description:
## Problem
Users cannot edit their profile from the profile view. They must navigate to Settings to find profile editing options.

## Expected Behavior
When viewing your own profile, there should be an 'Edit Profile' button that either:
1. Opens an inline edit mode
2. Navigates to Settings with profile section focused

## Current Behavior
ProfileView shows Follow/Unfollow and Mute/Unmute buttons for OTHER users, but shows no action buttons when viewing your own profile.

## Location
apps/gallery/src/ProfileView.tsx (around line 305-331)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Add 'Edit Profile' button visible when isMe === true
- [ ] Button should navigate to Settings or open inline editor
- [ ] Proper styling consistent with other buttons

title: Fix React hooks violations in custom hooks causing login failures
description:
## Problem
Login flow fails with React error: 'Rendered fewer hooks than expected. This may be caused by an accidental early return statement.'

## Root Cause
Multiple custom hooks have patterns that may violate React's Rules of Hooks during authentication state transitions (pubkey: null  value):

### Hooks Requiring Investigation:
1. **useMuteList.ts** (lines 19-24) - Conditional state updates in useCallback
2. **useContactList.ts** - Early returns in async callbacks
3. **useDMs.ts** (line 28-29) - Conditional useEffect returns
4. **Auth Provider** (packages/blog-kit/src/auth.tsx) - Multiple conditional paths

## Current Status
-  Fixed FeedView.tsx early return (commit 404231c)
-  Login still fails with hooks error

## Impact
**BLOCKER**: Users cannot log in to the application

## Testing
Run: `pnpm qa:regtest-demo`

Expected: Login succeeds and 'Live Feed' appears
Actual: Timeout waiting for 'Live Feed', hooks error in console

## References
- Test report: See commit message and investigation notes
- React Rules of Hooks: https://react.dev/reference/rules/rules-of-hooks

title: A11y: Document accessibility patterns and guidelines
description:
Create comprehensive accessibility documentation for contributors.

Create docs/accessibility.md with:

1. Overview
   - WCAG 2.1 AA compliance target
   - Why accessibility matters for Nostr/Lightning
   
2. Component Patterns
   - Modal dialogs (focus trap, escape key)
   - Form controls (labels, errors, hints)
   - Interactive buttons (states, loading)
   - Live regions (status updates, notifications)
   - Navigation (landmarks, skip links)

3. Testing Guide
   - Running axe-core tests locally
   - Manual keyboard navigation testing
   - Screen reader testing (VoiceOver/NVDA)
   - Lighthouse accessibility audits

4. Checklist for New Components
   - ARIA attributes checklist
   - Keyboard interaction patterns
   - Focus management requirements
   - Color contrast validation

5. Resources
   - WCAG 2.1 quick reference
   - ARIA authoring practices
   - MDN accessibility guides

Acceptance:
- docs/accessibility.md created and comprehensive
- CONTRIBUTING.md links to accessibility guidelines
- Pattern library includes a11y examples in Storybook stories

title: Add thread/conversation view for posts
description:
## Problem
Posts are flat. Clicking a post or reply doesn't show the conversation context. Users can't follow threaded discussions.

## User Story
As a user, I want to click on a post and see the full thread (parent posts and all replies) so I can follow conversations.

## Technical Approach
1. Create ThreadView component
2. When post clicked, fetch parent chain (follow 'e' tags with 'reply' marker up to root)
3. Fetch all replies (events with 'e' tag pointing to this event)
4. Display as nested tree with indentation (max depth 5, already in code)
5. Add navigation to go 'back to feed'

## Acceptance Criteria
- Clicking post opens thread view
- Parent chain visible above clicked post
- Replies shown below with nesting
- 'Back to feed' navigation works
- Loading states for async fetch

title: A11y: Create Playwright accessibility test suite
description:
Create comprehensive E2E accessibility tests using Playwright + axe-core.

Test file: apps/gallery/tests/accessibility.spec.ts

Test coverage:
- Run axe-core on all major pages/views
- Test keyboard navigation flows
- Test screen reader announcements (aria-live regions)
- Test focus management in modals
- Test form error associations (aria-describedby)
- Test color contrast (WCAG AA minimum)

Pages to test:
- / (feed view)
- /login
- /wallet
- /search
- Modal flows: zap, reply, help

Acceptance:
- Zero axe-core violations on all pages
- All critical user flows work with keyboard only
- Test suite runs in CI (add to .github/workflows/ci.yml)
- Documentation includes running a11y tests locally
- Coverage report shows tested components

title: Refactor embed package into testable modules
description:
## Problem
embed/src/index.ts is 2,400 LOC single file with:
- 15+ closure state variables without clear ownership
- 20+ try-catch-ignore patterns
- Magic numbers (INVOICE_TTL_SECS, RING_CIRCUMFERENCE, polling intervals)
- Memory leak potential in event listener cleanup
- No unit tests for core widget logic

## Solution
1. Split into modules: widgets/, state/, network/, ui/
2. Extract state management to state machine pattern
3. Centralize constants in config.ts
4. Add unit tests for renderTipWidget and renderCommentWidget (1000+ LOC each)

## Acceptance Criteria
- No file over 500 LOC
- State machine for widget lifecycle
- 80%+ test coverage on widget logic
- Memory leak tests for mount/destroy cycles

title: Improve DM list with profiles and previews
description:
## Problem
DM list shows only hex pubkeys. Users cannot identify who they're talking to. No last message preview, no unread indicators.

## User Story
As a user, I want to see profile names, avatars, and message previews in my DM list so I can identify conversations.

## Technical Approach
1. Resolve profile metadata (kind 0) for each conversation partner
2. Display avatar, display name, and NIP-05 if available
3. Show truncated last message text (decrypted)
4. Add unread indicator (count or dot)
5. Sort by most recent message

## Acceptance Criteria
- Avatar and display name shown for each conversation
- Last message preview (50 chars) visible
- Unread indicator for new messages
- Sorted by recency

title: Add type-safe DOM extensions for embed widgets
description:
## Problem
The embed package uses 20+ @ts-ignore directives for DOM property extensions (e.g., el.__nostrstackDestroy). This bypasses TypeScript's type safety and makes debugging difficult.

## Solution
1. Create proper type declarations for extended DOM elements
2. Use WeakMap pattern instead of direct DOM property assignment
3. Add Zod schemas for WebSocket/API message parsing

## Acceptance Criteria
- Zero @ts-ignore in embed/src
- WeakMap pattern for widget lifecycle
- Zod schemas for message parsing

title: QA: Regtest pay button missing after invoice ready
description:
## Problem
The QA test `pnpm qa:regtest-demo` fails with:
```
Error: Regtest pay button missing after invoice ready.
```

## Context
- Login works correctly
- Onboarding is skipped
- ZAP button is clickable (no more overlay issues)
- Payment modal opens with invoice
- But regtest pay button is not appearing

## Investigation needed
- Check PaymentModal component for regtest pay button rendering logic
- Verify VITE_ENABLE_REGTEST_PAY env var is correctly set
- Check if the button is conditionally rendered based on network detection

## Acceptance Criteria
- `pnpm qa:regtest-demo` passes completely
